values:
(Dr. Nick Riviera)  HEYYY EVERYBODY!!!!!!!!!
dont go crazy or anything just makin a cameo....
 I know it's way too early for this but i just felt like it:


1. What did you do in 2006 that you'd never done before?
Ate catfish.  (hey i'm a picky eater so that is a leap!)

2. Did you keep your new years' resolutions, and will you make more for next year?
About that weight thing...hehe....not fat yet but these lovehandles are peekin!

3. Did anyone close to you give birth?
nah

4. Did anyone close to you die?
probably

5. What countries did you visit?
tupelo, mississippi  -- again

6. What would you like to have in 2006 that you lacked in 2005?
a bank statment that is not printed entirely in RED INK

7. What date from 2006 will remain etched upon your memory, and why?
mar 5
i asked to keep her :P

8. What was your biggest achievement of the year?
finally performing again (Nexus)

9. What was your biggest failure?
that #8 took so DAMN long!

10. Did you suffer illness or injury?
i diagnosed myself with glaucoma and asthma, but luckily i took medication for it :P
ALL BETTER!

11. What was the best thing you bought?
a fish named elvis

12. Whose behavior merited celebration?
dana -- u go college boy!!!   ehh i got nuthin

13. Whose behavior made you appalled and depressed?
bush

14. Where did most of your money go?
what money? there was money?!?

15. What did you get really, really, really excited about?
my trip to georgia

16. What song will always remind you of 2006?
i'll have to get back to you on that

17. Compared to this time last year, are you:

Happier or sadder? happier
Older or wiser? weiser 
Thinner or fatter? fatter
Richer or poorer? richer

18. What do you wish you'd done more of?
pennypinching

19. What do you wish you'd done less of?
skipping meals

20. How will you be spending Christmas?
with Shana and her family

21. How will you be spending New Year's Eve?
drinking to blinding excess

22. Did you fall in love in 2006?
yes

23. How many one-night stands?
nil

24. What was your favorite TV program?
the black-screen-no-cable-marathon

25. Do you hate anyone now that you didn't hate this time last year?
no

26. What was the best book you read?
newspaper's my only reading material

27. What was your greatest musical discovery?
i may be late on this one, but country music

28. What did you want and get?
a gig

29. What did you want and not get?
a million dollar gig

30. What was your favorite film of this year?
click

31. What did you do on your birthday, and how old were you?
I turned 22--i went peach picking with shana whilst visiting georgia

32. What one thing would have made your year immeasurably more satisfying?
a snickers..... :P

33. How would you describe your personal fashion concept in 2006?
plain white tee, khaki shorts, $.95 flip-flops (black), and red hat

34. What kept you sane?
my lifemate

35. Which celebrity/public figure did you fancy the most?
......still Gwen........

36. What political issue stirred you the most?
Gay marriage/immigration

37. Who did you miss?
i "missed" Toonces, but I brought him here!

38. Who was the best new person you met?
every new person is always the best new person

39. Tell us a valuable life lesson you learned in 2006:
there's an old saying, goes: "Whitewater in the morning............well, that's it..."

40. Quote a song lyric that sums up your year:

It's raining men! Hallelujah!.......just kidding

I am probably going to be playing only 3 songs next Tuesday @ Arsaga's. 
It'll just be me and a guitar.  I already know I will be playing "Hope She's Happier" by Bill Withers and "Night Flight" by Led Zeppelin as songs 2 and 3.  However, I don't know what I should play as my first song.  

ANY SUGGESTIONS?!?!?!?!

PLEASE HELP!!!!!!!!

I'm here.  I'm still here.
 
I've got a lot of things going on over here.  Exciting things.  Interesting people.  We've got a few more songs down and recorded for to add to the Nexus catalogue--I'm sure you'd enjoy these.  I will be showcasing my guitar patchiness next Tuesday at Arsaga's if anyone is interested.  Right now I'm just waiting for Dana & Sarahbell to return from Europe.  I'm losing my mind!!!

One evening as the sun went down
And the jungle fire was burning
Down the track came a hobo hiking
And said "boys, I'm not turning"
I'm headed for a land that's far away
Beside the crystal fountains
So come with me we'll go and see
The big rock candy mountains

In the big rock candy mountains
There's a land that's fair and bright
Where the handouts grow on bushes
And you sleep out every night
Where the boxcars all are empty
And the sun shines every day
On the birds and the bees and the cigarette trees
The lemonade springs where the bluebird sings
In the big rock candy mountains

In the big rock candy mountains
All the cops have wooden legs
And the bulldogs all have rubber teeth
And the hens lay soft boiled eggs
The farmers trees are full of fruit
And the barns are full of hay
Well I'm bound to go where there ain't no snow
Where the rain don't fall and the wind don't blow
In the big rock candy mountains....

In the big rock candy mountains
you never change your socks
And the little streams of alcohol
Come a'tricklin' down the rocks
And the brakemen have to tip their hats
And the railroad bulls are blind
There's a lake of stew and of whiskey too
You can paddle all around 'em in a big canoe
In the big rock candy mountains

In the big rock candy mountains
The jails are made of tin
And you can walk right out again
As soon as you are in
There ain't no short handled shovels
No axes, saws, or picks
I'm gonna stay where you sleep all day
Where they hung the jerk that invented work
In the big rock candy mountains

I'll see you all this comin fall
In the big rock candy mountains...

****************************************************************************

When my belly starts a'rumblin
And I'm jonesin' for a treat
I close my eyes for a big surprise
The Tendercrisp Bacon Cheddar Ranch

I love the Tendercrisp Bacon Cheddar Ranch
The breasts that grow on trees
And streams of bacon ranch dressing
Flow right up to your knees
There's tumble weeds of bacon
And cheddar paves the streets
Folks don't front you 'cause you got the juice
Theres the trailer ladies comin' with a nice kaboose
Never get in any trouble never need an excuse
That's the Tendercrisp Bacon Cheddar Ranch

I love the Tendercrisp Bacon Cheddar Ranch
No one tells you to behave (behave!)
Your wildest fantasies come true
Dallas cheerleaders gives you shaves
Red onions make you laught instead
And French fries grow like weeds
You get the veg all day
All the lotto tickets paid
There's a king who wants you to have it your way
That's the Tendercrisp Bacon Cheddar Ranch
 (COME AN' GET IT!)

You Are 25 Years Old
25
Under 12: You are a kid at heart. You still have an optimistic life view - and you look at the world with awe. 13-19: You are a teenager at heart. You question authority and are still trying to find your place in this world. 20-29: You are a twentysomething at heart. You feel excited about what's to come... love, work, and new experiences. 30-39: You are a thirtysomething at heart. You've had a taste of success and true love, but you want more! 40+: You are a mature adult. You've been through most of the ups and downs of life already. Now you get to sit back and relax.

SO at work Vanessa and I always talk about Trivial Pursuit 80s & 90s because we are always talking about the 80s & 90s.  So I get back to work today and she hands me this big purple-wrapped box. I unwrap it and its TRIVIAL PURSUIT - 90s!!!!
I stopped by my friend's house after work to gloat and learned that I had, much to her father's discontent, called her house at some perverse hour of the night on saturday.  I don't recall and stand by my denial :)
Mommy and David got me a radio-thingy for my car and I am happy. Mommy also gave me Jose Cuervo-filled chocolates so that made me extra happy.
 
Time for din-din.

a card that reads:
 
 
 
CANCER
Jun 22 - Jul 22
Absolute Pervert
 
"You are the loving protective type.  Whether you are male or female, people wonder if you are afflicted with chronic PMS.  Cancers tend to be sexually confused because of their inexplicable desire to shove objects in their anal cavities."
  
 
 

Oh what a wonderful christmas this has been!

Stolen from Amber this year
 
 
1. What did you do in 2004 that you'd never done before?
Firmly clench a 4 octave vocal range 

2. Did you keep your new years' resolutions, and will you make more for next year?
Oh yeah...that weight issue.......damn that issue.....

3. Did anyone close to you give birth? 
They aren't due this year...

4. Did anyone close to you die?
sure

5. What countries did you visit?
Germany, Netherlands, France, Switzerland, Austria

6. What would you like to have in 2005 that you lacked in 2004?
companionship

7. What date from 2004 will remain etched upon your memory, and why?
My birthday--I spent it visiting a country I haven't been to in like 14 years

8. What was your biggest achievement of the year?
Financing a new car

9. What was your biggest failure?
Making everyone happy

10. Did you suffer illness or injury?
I have a head cold right now actually

11. What was the best thing you bought?
A silver, 5-speed 2000 Toyota Celica GT equipped w/catback exhaust, tinted windows, moon roof, 2 12" MTX subwoofers,...

12. Whose behavior merited celebration?
John--the man finally gave up smoking--you go boyyyyy

13. Whose behavior made you appalled and depressed?
my own mind

14. Where did most of your money go?
Bills, bebe

15. What did you get really, really, really excited about?
I thought I was going to see someone

16. What song will always remind you of 2004?
No Speech or Electric Nights by Guano Apes

17. Compared to this time last year, are you:

Happier or sadder? happier
Older or wiser? weiser :P
Thinner or fatter? fatter
Richer or poorer? richer

But mama, you been on my mind.

Went to go see the Manson show at the Tabernacle last night and my god it was packed. I made my way up to the front row in the great sea of weirdos by the middle of the show.  I should have died last night. It was a really good show too.  Afterwards, Ryan and I went back to his place to get closer to god. We then departed for Wafflehouse and consumed to our digestive system's content. "Shortly" afterwards I left to see the dear and ceaselessly hospitable Caitlin to deliver her my Christmas "ornament" of which she is, I'm sure, SO delighted to own now and display on her tree.  But she'll never look at reindeer the same way again... :)
Once again, she let me play the bum and crash at her place until around 8 am like the merciful and benevolent benefactor she is :P  And I deeply apologize for leaving my nasty gum on the table like that...I totally forgot about it.
 
STORYTIME!
 
So I left Atlanta a little after 8 and stopped to get gas in Newnan.  I didn't bother looking at the price of the midgrade while I pulled in--I merely glanced at the sign on the road. I stared at the gallon counter while I pumped.  When I was finished it stopped at 8 and something gallons. I had paid by credit with no receipt at the pump itself. Before I got into my car I finally roused the curiosity to know how much exactly the gas cost.  
 
The pump said I just paid $1.50
 
I looked at the gallons and back at the price and back at the gallons and so on...
Then I looked at the price per gallon display and saw that what should've been $1.87 was $0.187
 
So I got away with 8 gallons of gas for a buck and a half. 
Good times.
 
So after a night of raunchy and rowdy filth, people, and musicians--I drove back to town this morning because I could not miss church as I am a member of the choir :)
 
The End

It makes you wanna shake your ass and hump like hell beasts. But yeah this album is HOT. Like Hotness. So go buy it.

So we did kareoke last night at some bar'n'steakhouse place.
 
I opened up with "Twelfth Of Never" by Johnny Mathis and I feel I did pretty good considering the girl who runs it came out of her booth to see if I was actually singing or not as she said looking me up and down "I'm juss tryin to figure out where that voice is comin from!"
 
I followed it up with Chris Isaak "Let Me Down Easy".
 
David did his usual Weezer "Hashpipe" and STP "Interstate Love Song" and did a good job on it.
 
We convinced Clara to sing provided I go up there and help her out so we did "Underneath It All" by No Doubt. Everybody of course LOVED Clara for that. hehe...drunk people...
 
I went up again and sang "When The Levee Breaks" by Led Zeppelin.  I followed that one with "Luck Be A Lady" by Frank Siantra and nailed it. 
 
They then annouced they were doing a one-song contest for a prize and we all jumped on it.  David sang "Are You Gonna Go My Way", Clara sang "Fallin'", Sissy the drunk lady sang "Diamonds Are A Girls's Best Friend", some other guy sang a Creed song, Matt sang "Sexual Healing", and I sang "Sunspot Baby".  The Creed guy and Matt tied for 1st and I came in 2nd by 1 point.  They both got a gift certificate and some Cottonmouth tickets.  I walked out with shame........... nah just kidding.
 
That just means I need to pick a better song next time. Oh well.
 
That's for that. I'm going to Atlanta in a few minutes.
 
Have a nice Thanxgiving yo.
